discussion.content: This question is on the exam.

so... you have information of subnet and a host and about outbound communication and based on that you're able to infer this is data exfiltration.
I don't think you can infer more than probability of endpoint being rogue.

comments.content: Rogue endpoint would suggest that the device is not supposed to be there.... There is less info to confirm that than there is to confirm data exfil... So I'd go with Data Exfil

From the Cybersecurity Analyst Certification Bundle:

"A common approach to exfiltrating data is to first consolidate it in a staging location within the target network. Adversaries donâ€™t want to duplicate efforts or exfiltration streams because such duplication would also make them easier to detect. Instead, they will typically coordinate activities within a compromised network. This means that even if multiple agents are searching for sensitive files in different subnets, they will tend to copy those files at the coordination hub at which they are staged, prepared, and relayed to an external repository. Unfortunately, these internal flows will usually be difficult to detect because they may resemble legitimate functions of the organization."

discussion.content: There's very little information for this question to say that this is data exfil. Initiating outbound connections to suspicious ip addresses can mean different sort of things, but, i think it is safe to say that this is a rogue endpoint.

questions.question_text:
An analyst identifies multiple instances of node-to-node communication between several endpoints within the 10.200.2.0/24 network and a user machine at the IP address 10.200.2.5. This user machine at the IP address 10.200.2.5 is also identified as initiating outbound communication during atypical business hours with several IP addresses that have recently appeared on threat feeds.
Which of the following can be inferred from this activity?

A system administrator is doing network reconnaissance of a company's external network to determine the vulnerability of various services that are running.
Sending some sample traffic to the external host, the administrator obtains the following packet capture:
//IMG//

Based on the output, which of the following services should be further tested for vulnerabilities?

discussion.content: This is A. Only port 22/ssh replied with SA flag, meaning that the port is open. port 445 and 80 replied with RA flag, meaning port is closed.
This question is on the exam.
A A A A A A A
This site needs to be updated ASAP. Geez! The number of incorrect answers is comical

comments.content: This is intended to force people to study and do research not just memorizing the answers.

discussion.content: Are they thinking that the domain can resolve to other IP addresses in the future, that's why blocking via domain/url is the best choice?

comments.content: I'd go with D on this one.

Blocking the domain is the MOST effective way to deal with this one. Otherwise if you block all those ports you may have problem with other services/applications on the network or if you block the ip address then you may be blocking normal/expected business traffic to other domains under that same ip address.

questions.question_text:
Ransomware is identified on a company's network that affects both Windows and MAC hosts. The command and control channel for encryption for this variant uses TCP ports from 11000 to 65000. The channel goes to good1. Iholdbadkeys.com, which resolves to IP address 72.172.16.2.
Which of the following is the MOST effective way to prevent any newly infected systems from actually encrypting the data on connected network drives while causing the least disruption to normal Internet traffic?

choices.A: Block all outbound traffic to web host good1 iholdbadkeys.com at the border gateway.
choices.D: Block all outbound traffic on TCP ports 11000 to 65000 to IP host address 172.172.16.2 at the border gateway.
choices.B: Block all outbound TCP connections to IP host address 172.172.16.2 at the border gateway.
choices.C: Block all outbound traffic on TCP ports 11000 to 65000 at the border gateway.

discussion.content: This question is on the exam.

comments.content: Re-reading A has everything that C does in addition to DLP. A should be a better answer

No, dlp has customizable rules, for example: in this case it could even specify that only the director can send emails with PII

The answer is A!

discussion.content: I would say C would be a better answer. DLP would mostly be for external exfiltrations.

questions.question_text:
A human resources employee sends out a mass email to all employees that contains their personnel records. A security analyst is called in to address the concern of the human resources director on how to prevent this from happening in the future.
Which of the following would be the BEST solution to recommend to the director?

choices.A: Install a data loss prevention system, and train human resources employees on its use. Provide PII training to all employees at the company. Encrypt PII information.
choices.D: Install specific equipment to create a human resources policy that protects PII data. Train company employees on how to handle PII data. Outsource all PII to another company. Send the human resources director to training for PII handling.
choices.B: Enforce encryption on all emails sent within the company. Create a PII program and policy on how to handle data. Train all human resources employees.
choices.C: Train all employees. Encrypt data sent on the company network. Bring in privacy personnel to present a plan on how PII should be handled.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Social media profiling- "used a professional directory to identify a network administrator"
phishing- "Joe then emailed the network administrator, identifying himself as the ID administrator"

questions.question_text: Joe, a penetration tester, used a professional directory to identify a network administrator and ID administrator for a client's company. Joe then emailed the network administrator, identifying himself as the ID administrator, and asked for a current password as part of a security exercise. Which of the following techniques were used in this scenario?
